SEARCH
Package com.github.alexisc183.jforconsol

Class JInputRequest<T>

java.lang.Object
com.github.alexisc183.jforconsol.JInputRequest<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the input to request
public class JInputRequest<T> extends Object
Request of an input value to the user with the certainty of said value always being correct.

The purpose of this class is to provide abstraction to operations of requesting input data through for example, a command line interface. Programmers can opt to instantiate this class instead of making the logic of data collection by themselves, in this way reducing significantly the code and preventing undesired input data.

Since:
JForconsol 1.0.0
Version:
1, 2025-05-30
Author:
AlexisC183

  • Constructor Details

    • JInputRequest

      public JInputRequest(Parser<T> function)
      Creates an input request with the specified parsing method.
      Parameters:
      function - the function that converts a string to T
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the provided function is null

  • Method Details

    • isCancellable

      public boolean isCancellable()
      Checks whether this JInputRequest allows pressing its cancel button or not.
      Returns:
      true if this JInputRequest allows pressing its cancel button; false otherwise.

    • setCancellable

      public void setCancellable(boolean value)
      Sets whether this JInputRequest allows pressing its cancel button or not depending on the provided value.
      Parameters:
      value - If true, pressing cancel won't result in an invalid requested input, otherwise will.

    • getCondition

      public Predicate<T> getCondition()
      Returns the condition object for this input request.
      Returns:
      the predicate used to test the requested input

    • setCondition

      public void setCondition(Predicate<T> condition)
      Sets the condition property. This predicate is used to test a requested input.
      Parameters:
      condition - the predicate used to test the requested input

    • getErrorMessage

      public String getErrorMessage()
      Returns the errorMessage object for this input request.
      Returns:
      the string that may be printed if the user enters an invalid input

    • setErrorMessage

      public void setErrorMessage(String errorMessage)
      Sets the errorMessage property. This error message may be printed if the user enters an invalid input.
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - the string that may be printed if the user enters an invalid input

    • getRequestMessage

      public String getRequestMessage()
      Returns the requestMessage object for this input request.
      Returns:
      the string that is part of the JOptionPane dialog used by this instance

    • setRequestMessage

      public void setRequestMessage(String requestMessage)
      Sets the requestMessage property. This request message is part of the JOptionPane dialog used by this instance.
      Parameters:
      requestMessage - the string that is part of the JOptionPane dialog used by this instance

    • request

      public T request()
      Requests the input by invoking a JOptionPane dialog.
      Returns:
      a T from the converted input, or null if cancel was pressed according to the isCancellable property
      See Also:
      • isCancellable()
